bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, November 3, 1937

div1.p: Hench reports that Kissinger is in Florida until May, so an article will not be possible until after he returns.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, November 3, 1937
div1.opener:
November 3, 1937
Dr. Ralph C. Hutchison
Washington and Jefferson College
Washington, Pennsylvania
My dear Hutch:
div1.p:
I am sorry indeed to hear that Harriet
is still having some pain. Mother wrote me this
morning.

Kissinger is going to be in Florida
until May, so that I will not get at the article
until after I see him.

Mary and I are still planning to go
to England, attending a medical meeting and Interna-
tional Conference at Oxford, and one the following
week in Bath,--the last week in March and the first
week in April. We are then renting a car and will
drive around England for about four weeks, returning
about the middle of May. What are the chances of
you going along?
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
